subject: Critical Thinking
title: Magical Thinking: Rituals, Luck, and Invisible Forces
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Magical Thinking: Rituals, Luck, and Invisible Forces.

hook.text: You won't step on a crack. You knock on wood.

buildup.text: Magical thinking: believing your thoughts, words, or symbolic actions can influence physical reality without a causal link.

discovery.text: Piaget thought it was a childhood stage we outgrow. Research shows adults do it constantly ‚Äî especially under stress.

twist.text: Even rationalists practice it: refusing to say 'things are going well' for fear of jinxing it.

climax.text: Magical thinking isn't always harmful ‚Äì it can provide comfort & a sense of agency.

quiz.question: What is magical thinking?
options: Believing thoughts or symbolic actions can influence physical reality without a mechanism
